reviewText:
This is my first review, i dont do reviews. Before anything, excuse my english.

After I bought this game, i feel in debt with humanity, i have the duty to tell: this game sucks, hard.

a) Its a facebook game - i will not elaborate beyond that (poor graphics, gameplay, etc...)
b) Its a free game you can play from www.ufoonline.de
c) In the steam store there is no Play for free" option. GG

There is no much else to say. I feel like i just light up 6

reviewText: As a mega fan of the original UFO Enemy Unknown, X-Com series, and even the UFO trilogy.  I gave this game a chance keeping an open mind.  While already receiving negative feedback, I thought give it a go at least".  What disappointed me the most was waiting for the game to load into missions.  Concept in general is pretty good
date: yet too complex for my likings.  And I DO NOT like the idea of having to purchase additional credits (or diamonds) throughout the game."

reviewText:
This game has nothing to do with classic UFO. It's no different than any browser game with tactics" in its name.

made in flash
right mouse button opens adobe flash player pop up
very slow
opens in full screen on the primary display device
date:
not possible to change it no strategic part of the game:
no income other than from missions
no economy
no detecting or shooting down UFOs
single base only
base expansion is limited to upgrading 4 rooms poor tactical part of the game:
soldiers have a predefined class which defines their skills and equipment they can use
there is 5 weapons only
recommended: one for each class; they are exclusive to use for this class only\nthe equipment is limited to weapon
hoursPlayed: armor and two slots for usable items\npoor leveling system - acquring new stats is made by creating a path on the large triangle (see screenshots)
voteText:
you can get only a skill which is adjacent to previously chosen skill
character level is limited to 20 making it impossible to acquire all skills
slow experience income
putting soldier on watch (so it shoots during opponent's turn) consumes action points in both current turn and player's next turn - i.e. it counts as if the shot was made during player's next turn; putting soldier on watch costs more than making a single shot
very limited ammo on the missions
helpfulPercent: it's likely that you will run out of it\nknife (scout's main and only weapon) requires ammo\nweapons have min/max range and optimal range - shooting outside min/max range is not even possible
votesHelpful: shooting at range different than optimal is most likely to miss and even if it hits the damage will be much lower. And so sniper rifle has range 4-14
column17: 1 optimal. There is enemy at distance of 6-7 squares? You are unlucky. limited storage for items
column18: at the beginning you can store only ~15 items
column19:
later +1 per level of the storage room (max level 30)
multiple interface bugs
it is sometimes not possible to move an item from soldier's inventory to storage room or the other way round
sometimes interface freezes during mission while the turn timer is still counting down
column20: after 30-60 seconds interface unfreezes and starts processing all mouse events so if you clicked in multiple places you are likely to end up with your soldiers moving to places where you never inteded them to go\nselected soldier sometimes becomes unselected without reason\nif you try to give an order to the soldier during animation
column22: the order won't be executed - generally you cannot use mouse during animations\nsometimes it's not possible to scroll the map during oponent's turn - so you can hear your soldiers getting shot without knowing where and by what\nsometimes movement paths are not cleared as all browser games
column23:
it is a pay-to-win - you can buy diamonds for real money and use them to buy absolutely anything in the game
one of the "campaign" tasks cannot be completed preventing you from getting further "campaign" tasks
some of the daily tasks require you to spend ~12h to complete them (e.g. kill 500 aliens where on mission is ~10 aliens and it takes ~15 minutes to complete a mission); you have 24h to complete a task once started
game requests administrator permissions on every startup
starter packs give you soldiers at maximum level with super equipment - the game becomes pointless
column24: because the only thing left is research and upgrading rooms\nupgrading rooms and researching is done in real time (e.g. 2 hours)"

reviewText:
Dont buy it

the game ask you to install Unity Plugin, but even if you install it and restart game wont start but keeps asking you to install Unity Plugin




Important Information Regarding the „Unity 3D Webplayer not found” - Message

Monday, 3:36pm

New



In the Steam-version of UFO Online as well as in the Chrome-Version 42 the game respectively the browser report a missing Unity 3D Web player and advises to download and install the plugin. After the installation of the plugin the message returns and the game cannot be continued.

Explanation:
UFO Online uses the Unity 3D Web player i.a. to display the 3D-Scenes in battles. Google has discontinued the support for NPAPI plugins from version 42 on, including the Unity 3D Web player. This affects the Steam-version of UFO Online, which is using components of the Chrome-Browser. This circumstance is final and cannot be fixed from our side. UFO Online will no longer be available on Steam and in Chrome-browsers starting from version 42.

Solution:
Do you have a Steam-version and want to continue playing with your save game on play.ufoonline.de? Please contact the support on ufosteam@funatics.de and send us your hero name.

We advise browser players to use The Mozilla Firefox browser for playing UFO Online.

Your UFO Online-Team

reviewText:
It's free to play on website, but you can buy steam packs too.  Almost better to go free, unless you want bonuses.  You get what you pay for with the packs, it saved a good 10-20 hours of game play to level up.

Great game.  Only about 10-20 hours of new content, but it repeats and has pvp.  It's a browser game and it's okay if you need something to play at work or on a laptop or on the go devices.

It's not a graphics powerhouse, but it gets the job done for some fun in the office.
